On this page

Welcome to the ultimate guide for activating Windows and Office using trusted open-source methods. ‚Äã

This comprehensive guide walks you through reliable, open-source methods ‚Äî like HWID, KMS, TSforge, and more ‚Äî to activate your Windows and Office safely and permanently.

Author's Notes

  • After activation via the HWID method, you may encounter issues signing into your Microsoft account in Microsoft Edge browser settings!
  • Solution 1: Skip this activation method< and use KMS instead (takes less than 2 minutes and requires renewal every 6 months).
  • Solution 2: Avoid Edge and switch to alternative browsers like Chrome or Firefox.
Click here to see the details
  • For Windows: I personally use the KMS method [see guides] for my Windows 10/11 activations. It's official, leaves no files on the system, and takes less than 3 minutes. If for some reason that fails, HWID is my go-to, as it's also official and file-less.
  • For Office: I use Ohook, TSforge, or Online KMS. The small differences are noted in the summary table above.
  • Need Help? If you run into any issues, feel free to ask in the GitHub Discussions or Email me directly.

Activation Methods Summary ‚Äã

For a quick overview, here is a summary of the activation methods available:

Activation TypeSupported ProductActivation PeriodInternet Needed?More Info
HWIDWindows 10-11PermanentYesDetails
KMSWindows 10-11180 Days (Manual)YesDetails
OhookOfficePermanentNo-
TSforgeWindows / ESU / OfficePermanentYes (on build 19041+)Details
KMS38Windows 10-11-ServerUntil 2038NoDetails
Online KMSWindows / Office180 Days (Lifetime with Renewal)YesDetails

For a detailed comparison of all methods, check out the Activation Methods Chart.


Method 1. Permanent Activation with HWID ‚Äã

For most users, the HWID (Hardware ID) method is the simplest way to get a permanent digital license for Windows 10 and 11.

Step 1. Open PowerShell as Administrator ‚Äã

Run PowerShell using search bar

    1. Click on windows Start button or Search icon in the taskbar.
    1. Type powershell.
    1. Select Run as administrator.


Another ways to run PowerShell

Click here to see more ways

1. Using search bar

    1. Click on windows Start button or Search icon in the taskbar.
  1. Type powershell.
  2. Select Run as administrator.

2. Using the Run box

    1. Open the Run dialog box: Simultaneously Press Win (‚äû) + R keys on your keyboard.
    1. Type: powershell.
    1. Run as administrator: Instead of just pressing Enter, press Ctrl + Shift + Enter. This combination will launch PowerShell with elevated (administrator) privileges.
    1. If prompted by the User Account Control dialog, click Yes to grant administrative privileges.

3. Using Power User Menu (Win+X)

    1. Right-click on the Start menu.
    1. Then select Windows Terminal (Admin) on Windows 11 or Windows PowerShell (Admin) on Windows 10 to run PowerShell.

Or You can visit this Link to see 10 ways to run PowerShell And this link For Running CMD in your windows.

Step 2. Run the Activation Script ‚Äã

Copy the following command, paste it into the PowerShell window and press Enter key.

You can paste everything you copied by Right-clicking in CMD Or PowerShell Or other terminals.

powershell
irm https://get.activated.win | iex
1
powershell
irm https://massgrave.dev/get | iex
1


Step 3. Choose the HWID Option ‚Äã

A menu will appear in a new window. Press 1 number on your keyboard to select HWID Activation and wait a few moments for the process to complete.


Congratulations!
Your Windows is now permanently activated with a digital license.

To check the activation status of Windows 10, navigate to Settings ‚Üí Update & Security ‚Üí Activation. [1]

To check the activation status of Windows 11, open Settings by clicking the Start button and then selecting Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Activation. [2]

Additional Information ‚Äã

How to Remove Activations

Click here to see the details
  • HWID: A digital license is stored on Microsoft's servers and tied to your hardware. It cannot be "removed" in the traditional sense. A major hardware change (like the motherboard) will invalidate it. To return to an unactivated state, you can install a generic KMS key. Extended hwid details
  • Online KMS / Ohook / KMS38: Use the corresponding "Uninstall" or "Remove" option within the MAS script menu, then run the "Fix Licensing" option from the Troubleshoot menu. KMS details and KMS38 details
  • TSforge: This method only appends data and doesn't install files. To reset it, simply run the "Fix Licensing" option from the Troubleshoot menu in the MAS script. TSforge details

  1. To check the activation status of Windows 10, navigate to Settings ‚Üí Update & Security ‚Üí Activation. You will see your activation status listed there. If Windows is activated, you should see "Activated" with a green checkmark. ‚Ü©Ô∏é

  2. To check the activation status of Windows 11, open Settings by clicking the Start button and then selecting Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Activation. The activation status will be displayed, showing whether Windows is activated, along with details about the activation method and any linked Microsoft account. ‚Ü©Ô∏é
